page.title: 07CASTELL COLLEN
page.content: Castell Collen is the largest main Roman Camp in Wales.It has four entrances.One entrance goes through the river.There is always water at the camp.The camp itself inculdes an area of nearly four acres forming almost a square about 142 yards in length by 132 in breadth.The Romans built it in 75-85AD while fighting against the Silures.In the 2nd century AD they changed the defences to stone.There is a long straight where they used to train horses.The archaeologists found that they had baths and a form of central heating.All you can see now is a few stones and bumps.I went to see it.It is also covered with grass.
